definition: down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: The debate follows the rules of procedure used in the British House of Commons .
sentences.chinese: 该辩论招待英国下院的程序规则。

sentences.english: Two rows of seat in the house of commons, behind the front bench, where ordinary member of parliament sit.
sentences.chinese: 下院中前排座后面的两排座位，普通议员在此就座。

sentences.english: Tomorrow, the House of Commons will see the third and final reading of the Health Bill.
sentences.chinese: 明天，议会下院将进行健康法案的最终审读。

sentences.english: Sorry I am to hear the liberty of speech in this House imputed as a crime.
sentences.chinese: 我十分遗憾地听到言论自由在下院被判定为一种罪行。

sentences.english: The motion was steamrollered through in the lower chamber.
sentences.chinese: 该项动议在下院被强行通过了。

sentences.english: In the building there is the house of commons and the house of lords .
sentences.chinese: 英国议会上院和下院都在这幢大楼里。

sentences.english: On March 11, the bill to ratify the treaty cleared the House of Commons.
sentences.chinese: 三月十一日，接受条约的法案在议会下院获得通过。

sentences.english: The Samajwadi Party controls 39 members of parliament in the 543 lower house of parliament.
sentences.chinese: 印度社会党在由543人组成的议会下院占有39席。

sentences.english: Private members attack the government for not spend enough money on the police.
sentences.chinese: 下院议员批评政府没有在员警身上花足够的钱。

definition: lower chamber (of legislative body)/lower house/the House of Commons
two chambers (of legislative assembly), e.g. House of Representatives and Senate
